The Facebook post has been shared more t: 300 times, indicating a level of interest and potential belief in the claim.
The Sinhala: language caption of the post translates to English as "Make the syrup at home and drink," suggesting that it is presenting a recipe for a Covid-19 cure.
Medical professionals: including Sri Lanka's newly appointed Covid-19 disease control State Minister Sudarshini Fernandopulle and Dr. Haritha Aluthge of the Government Medical Officers' Association (GMOA), have advised against consuming or creating the purported "miracle cure," highlighting concerns about its safety and effectiveness.
Dr: L.P.A. Karunathilake, a senior lecturer of indigenous medicine at Colombo University, states that while some of the ingredients in the recipe may have immunity-boosting properties, they are not sufficient to cure Covid-19. He suggests that the alleged cure should be tested at reputable institutions to determine its efficacy.
